newsitem.title: DUBAI: Accor to manage Mercure hotel in Dubai.
newsitem.headline: Accor to manage Mercure hotel in Dubai.

text.p: French hotel group Accor said on Thursday it would open its first Grand Mercure hotel in the Middle East in Dubai by the end of the year.

In a statement it said the luxury 12-storey hotel and apartment building was under construction at the Deira City Centre in Dubai. The complex is owned by private United Arab Emirates firm Majid al-Futtaim Group of Companies.
The hotel will have 327 rooms and 112 serviced apartments.
Accor vice-president of operations Alexandre Solleiro said in the statement his group currently manages 28 hotels in the Middle East. The Mercure chain is one of six operated by Accor.
The statement gave no figure for the cost of the hotel or the Accor management fee.
